items.text:
ComponentActivity, the base
class for FragmentActivity
and AppCompatActivity,
allows you to control the behavior of the Back button by using its
OnBackPressedDispatcher,
which you can retrieve by calling getOnBackPressedDispatcher().
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers

items.text:
It is strongly recommended to
use the addCallback()
method which takes a LifecycleOwner.
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers
Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers

items.text:
If you are using
onBackPressed()
to handle Back button events, we recommend using a
OnBackPressedCallback instead.
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers

items.text:
When doing so, the callbacks are invoked in the reverse order in which they are
added - the callback added last is the first given a chance to handle the
Back button event.
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers

items.text: You can provide multiple callbacks via addCallback().
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers

items.text:
For example, if you added three callbacks named
one, two and three in order, they would be invoked in the order of
three, two, and one, respectively.
items.href: Provide custom back navigation  |  Android Developers
